XMLHttpRequestTimeout.summary: The XMLHttpRequest.timeout property is an unsigned long representing the number of milliseconds a request can take before automatically being terminated. The default value is 0, which means there is no timeout. Timeout shouldn't be used for synchronous XMLHttpRequests requests used in a 'document environment' or it will throw an InvalidAccessError exception. When a timeout happens, a timeout event is fired.

blockquote.para: Note: You may not use a timeout for synchronous requests with an owning window.

para.see: Using a timeout with an asynchronous request
